position: Campus Undergraduate - 2021Credit & Fraud Risk Summer Internship (Salt Lake City)
description:
Commercial Rating and Underwriting (CRU) sits within the Credit and Fraud Risk division within American Express. The CRU team plays the critical role of assessing and managing the risk of institutional exposures across all business units within American Express, and in all regions globally.  Credit exposures are primarily generated through corporate and small business card programs, via merchant service relationships where non-delivery risk exists, and among the securities portfolio held for firm-wide liquidity.  CRU is led from Salt Lake City with regional teams in New York, London, Singapore and Sydney.

In addition to determining the internal credit rating which drives the probability of default of each exposure, CRU also calculates the loss given default of these obligors while underwriting card programs. As a bank holding company, American Express must comply with the highest global banking standards set by Basel Committee and implemented by the bank’s primary regulator, the Federal Reserve.  

Job Responsibilities

Interns in CRU are responsible for rating and underwriting credit exposures in their assigned region, industry, and business line.  Fundamental analysis incorporates a thorough review of business, financial, industry and country risk coupled with support from internal and external rating model outputs.  Assessment includes understanding of the need for credit extension, profitability of the relationship and program structures.

Minimum Qualifications

Desired Skills:

  • Understanding of fundamental financial analysis including the ability to review corporate financial statements to determine the ability of the obligor to honor its credit obligations
  • Comfort with GAAP/IFRS accounting standards, corporate valuation, and forecasting
  • Comfort with public agency ratings and supporting analysis
  • Understanding of current macroeconomic trends and how to provide recommendations to improve the probability of default (PD) estimation based on the business cycle
  • Experience preparing company-specific and industry-wide credit memorandums
  • Familiarity with global markets (foreign language ability a plus)
  • Confident and persuasive written and verbal communicator 
  • Student working on a bachelor’s degree from a top tier university (a degree or substantial coursework in finance, accounting, economics, or statistics a plus)

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

  • Currently enrolled in a full-time undergraduate degree program

Hilton Co-Brand Marketing Execution Analyst

Description

The Partnership Marketing team is a significant driver of value to Consumer Card Members within the American Express franchise.  The team is dedicated to delivering best in class marketing experiences to grow American Express card holders and increase the amount of spending on those cards. 

The Hilton Co-Brand Marketing Execution Analyst will be responsible for successfully executing digital and offline campaigns for the Hilton Co-Brand partnership, specifically for loyalty marketing. The Analyst will collaborate with Marketing Managers, Creative Governance, Brand Teams, Legal and Compliance to define campaigns.  Analysts will then work with the Campaign Execution Marketing Services Team to build and launch campaigns into production.

Analysts will have the opportunity to learn specialized skills including digital marketing, project management, and relationship management, as well as becoming an expert on American Express systems, tools and cross functional teams. 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Manage end to end campaign execution for the digital and offline channels 
  • Support landing pages / applications improvements
  • Manage quarterly compliance review process
  • Coordinate with tech and prod management to complete any required updates
  • Support some efforts designed to improve the customer experience
  • Ownership of campaign calendar
  • Build cross-functional relationships across multiple internal & external partners
  • Become a team leader in driving change and creating efficiency in job

 

Minimum Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Desire to join a high-profile, results-oriented and dynamic team
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
  • A sense of humor, positive attitude and desire to learn
  • Extremely strong organizational skills including attention to detail, handling multiple priorities, managing tight timelines, driving flawless execution
  • Candidate must have a strong mix of analytical skills and strategic thinking with a demonstrated ability to drive business results
  • Proven ability to build and leverage relationships
  • Preferably have some corporate work experience, even if via an internship
  • Bachelor degree required
